episodes.title: Naming the psychological methods used to enforce compliance
episodes.description:
In this video, we begin a two-part series documenting interrogation tactics used in high-control religious environments, paired with real examples from our own lives.
This is not speculation or exaggeration. We are naming psychological and spiritual interrogation methods that were repeatedly used to create fear, compliance, confusion, and shame — often under the guise of care, discipleship, or concern.
In Part 1, we cover the first half of a longer list of interrogation tactics, explaining:
* What each tactic is
* How it functions psychologically
* What it looked like when it was used on us
These tactics are often subtle and normalized in high-control churches, which can make them difficult to recognize while you’re still inside. Naming them can be a critical step toward clarity and healing.
This video is intended to help:
* Survivors of spiritual abuse
* People questioning high-control religious dynamics
* Those trying to understand coercive questioning and control
Part 2 continues the list with the remaining interrogation tactics and additional real-life examples.
If any of this feels familiar, you’re not alone — and you’re not imagining it.

#ReligiousTrauma
#cultrecovery 
#SpiritualAbuse
#PsychologicalAbuse
#ChurchAbuse
#CoerciveControl
#excult 
#interrogation

episodes.title: The Evangelism Double Bind
episodes.description:
We were required to evangelize, given strict rules for how to do it, and then mocked for following those rules.This is how high-control religious systems create no-win situations and keep people trapped in shame.

In this video, we talk about how leaders demanded evangelism while constantly changing the rules — and then shamed people for “not doing it right” or “not doing enough.”

This tactic exploits empathy and a genuine desire to help others, turning compassion into a tool for control. It’s a classic psychological pattern found in cults and high-control groups:

• Double binds (you’re wrong no matter what you do)
• Moving goalposts
• Moral perfectionism
• Shame conditioning
• Emotional manipulation disguised as spiritual growth

If you’ve ever felt like your sincerity was never enough, this video is for you.

#ReligiousTrauma
#SpiritualAbuse
#Cult
#CoerciveControl
#PsychologicalManipulation
#NoWin
#Control
#Shame
#moralinjury 
#EmotionalManipulation

episodes.title: How High Demand Religious Leaders Rebrand Abuse as “Love”
episodes.description:
In this video, we expose how leaders in our former church reframed abuse as “love” — and how redefining harm allowed them to justify control, coercion, and mistreatment while claiming biblical authority.
We break down:
* How abusive behavior was rebranded as “care,” “discipline,” or “love”
* How scripture was weaponized to excuse harmful actions
* How victims were taught to doubt their own pain
* Why redefining abuse is one of the most dangerous tools of spiritual manipulation
When leaders control the definition of love, obedience becomes morality — and abuse becomes righteousness.
This video is for anyone who has experienced:
* spiritual abuse
* religious trauma
* coercive control in church leadership
* manipulation disguised as biblical love

If this resonates with you, you’re not alone.

#SpiritualAbuse #ReligiousTrauma #ChurchAbuse #SpiritualManipulation
#CoerciveControl #CultRecovery #cult #highdemandreligion

episodes.title: The Emotional Weight Placed on Members When People Leave the Church
episodes.description:
When someone leaves a high-control church or ministry, the members who remain are often left carrying an overwhelming emotional weight — not because they lack faith, but because their devotion is being used against them.
In this video, we talk about the emotional weight placed on church members when people leave — including the confusion, responsibility, and pressure to keep serving when things no longer make sense.
We share what it feels like to genuinely care about God and people, to be giving everything you have, and to suddenly feel responsible for someone else’s departure or for holding the system together.
We also explain why we cared so deeply about the people still inside, why we knew our presence mattered, and why leaving was one of the hardest decisions we’ve ever made — even though it was necessary.
If you’re still in a high-control religious environment, please hear this clearly: what is being placed on you is not fair, and it is not your fault.
You are not failing. You are surviving.

#spiritualabuse
#religioustrauma 
#emotionalmanipulation 
#churchabuse 
#coercivecontrol

episodes.title: Blamed for the Church’s Failures: How Cults Trap You in Impossible Cycles
episodes.description:
In this video, we share how we were repeatedly accused of not bringing in enough money to provide for all of the pastors, not evangelizing enough, not communicating enough, and ultimately not loving God or people enough—all while being told we were responsible for the failures of the ministry itself.
We explain how high-control religious groups and cult-like churches shift blame onto sincere members, constantly changing the rules and expectations so that nothing is ever enough. One moment the focus is money. The next, evangelism. But no matter what changes, the responsibility—and guilt—always stays with you.

This video is for anyone who has been told they are the problem in a religious organization that demands the impossible. If you’ve ever felt exhausted, ashamed, or spiritually defective for things that were never fair or achievable to begin with—this is not because you are a bad person.

You are not failing God.You are not selfish.You are not the reason the system doesn’t work.

We break down the manipulation tactics used by cults and abusive churches so that those still inside—or healing after leaving—can finally understand what was happening and begin to reclaim their sense of worth.

💬 If this resonates, you are not alone.
🔔 Subscribe for more content on spiritual abuse, coercive control, and recovery.

#spiritualabuse 
#manipulation 
#coercivecontrol 
#religioustrauma 
#cultsurvivor 
#cultrecovery 
#ChurchAbuse
#ReligiousManipulation
#DeconstructingFaith

episodes.title: When Churches Demand Money AND Free Labor: A Survivor’s Story
episodes.description:
In this video, we share our story of forced labor and financial abuse within a high-control church. Jonathan was pressured to give large sums of money while also being required to work at the pastor’s home — unpaid — as part of what was framed as “obedience” and “service to God.”
This is a deeply personal and vulnerable account of how religious authority can cross into coercion, exploitation, and abuse. What was presented as voluntarily giving, slowly became an expectation — and then a requirement.

We’re sharing this story to help others recognize the warning signs of financial abuse, labor exploitation, and spiritual coercion in religious settings. If you’ve ever felt pressured to give beyond your means, work without consent, or comply out of fear of spiritual consequences, you’re not alone.

This channel exists to bring awareness, support survivors, and help people name experiences that were normalized but deeply harmful.

#spiritualabuse 
#financialabuse 
#coercivecontrol 
#unpaidwork  
#cultsurvivor 
#ChurchHurt
#coercivecontrol

episodes.title: Signs of Financial Abuse in Religious Settings
episodes.description:
Financial abuse can occur in religious environments when giving, obedience, or “faithfulness” are tied to money, pressure, or fear. In this video, we discuss common warning signs of financial abuse in religious settings, including coercive giving, lack of transparency, spiritual consequences attached to money, and patterns that often appear in high-control groups.

This video is based on our personal experiences and observations and is shared to bring awareness, encourage healing, and help others recognize unhealthy financial dynamics in faith-based environments. Not every religious community operates this way, but these patterns show up repeatedly in coercive systems.

Our content reflects our opinions and lived experiences and is intended for education, advocacy, and discussion.
#FinancialAbuse 
#SpiritualAbuse 
#ChurchAbuse 
#ReligiousTrauma
#cultsurvivor 
#coercivecontrol 
#FaithAndMoney
#recovery

episodes.title: When Survivors Aren’t Believed: The Harm of Calling It “Gossip”
episodes.description:
When survivors speak about abuse, trauma, or harmful experiences, disbelief or accusations about their story being merely “gossip” can cause deep and lasting harm.
In this video, we talk about why questioning, minimizing, or labeling survivor stories as “gossip” doesn’t protect anyone—it silences survivors and discourages people from speaking about what happened to them.
Doubting survivors often leads to shame, isolation, and self-doubt, especially for those leaving high-control groups, religious trauma, or abusive environments. We explore how disbelief reinforces trauma and why listening to survivors matters more than protecting comfort, reputation, or image.
This video is not about gossip. It’s about survivor awareness, accountability, and creating space for truth to be spoken without punishment.
If you’re a survivor, you are not wrong for telling your story. And if you’re listening, believing survivors can be life-changing.


#BelieveSurvivors
#ReligiousTrauma
#TraumaAwareness
#SurvivorVoices
#SpiritualAbuse

episodes.title: It's Not Gossiping-It's Truth & Bringing Awareness to Church Abuse
episodes.description:
For years, we were told that asking questions or talking about what was happening to others was “gossip.”
But what we later realized is that this wasn’t about protecting people—it was about controlling information.
In this video, we talk about how the label of “gossip” was used to silence conversations, isolate individuals, and prevent people from knowing what was really happening inside a high-control religious environment.
We also break down what gossip actually is—and why sharing lived experiences, patterns of abuse, and systemic harm is not gossip, but awareness.
Our channel is not about tearing people down. It’s about naming harmful systems, validating survivors, and making sure others have the information we didn’t.
If you’ve ever felt confused, isolated, or ashamed for speaking up—this conversation is for you.
#ReligiousTrauma
#InformationControl
#CultRecovery
#HighControlGroups
#SpiritualAbuse

episodes.title: Raised to Fundraise:  We Were Taught that We Had to Make Money for the Church Since Childhood
episodes.description:
In this video, we talk about the many ways we were required and expected to make money for our church—and how this began when we were very young.

What was framed as “serving,” “discipline,” or “faithfulness” slowly became a system where financial contribution was tied to obedience, approval, and belonging.

We’re sharing our lived experiences to help others recognize patterns of financial control, especially when children are involved, and to remind survivors that these systems are not normal or healthy.

#ReligiousTrauma #ChurchAbuse #FinancialControl #CultRecovery #deconstruction #SurvivorVoices #SpiritualAbuse

episodes.title: Christmas In a High Control Christian Cult
episodes.description:
Christmas is supposed to be a season of joy, generosity, and peace.
But inside a high-control Christian group, joy itself was used as a tool of control.

In this video, we share what Christmas was like inside a Christian cult—where the “joy of the season” wasn’t about connection or rest, but about pulling people deeper into spiritual performance and further away from reality. Joy was emphasized not to bring safety, but to suppress fear, doubt, and discomfort. If something felt wrong, you were taught to push deeper into “joy” instead of listening to your instincts.

The Christmas season was also used to increase financial pressure. Giving was spiritualized, generosity was monitored, and money was framed as proof of faith—especially during a time when people were already emotionally vulnerable.

Every Christmas followed rigid rules. Everyone was required to read Luke 2. Presents could only be opened on Christmas. Traditions weren’t flexible or personal—they were enforced. What looked like reverence was often about compliance, and what looked like unity was maintained through fear of disobedience.

This video is not an attack on Christianity.
It is an honest account of spiritual abuse, coercive control, and religious trauma—especially how these dynamics intensify during the holidays.

If you’ve ever felt anxious, numb, or disconnected during Christmas while everyone around you insisted you should feel joyful, this story may resonate.

#religioustrauma 
#cultsurvivor 
#spiritualabuse 
#religiousabuse 
#christmas 
#ChristianCult
#HighControlReligion
#Trauma
#FaithAndControl
#Deconstruction

episodes.title: Coercive Control in High-Control Religious Environments
episodes.description:
In this video, we talk openly about coercive control and the psychological tactics that were used on us in the high-control religious environment we left. These tactics are often subtle, normalized, and difficult to recognize while you’re inside them — which is why leaving can feel confusing, frightening, and overwhelming.

We discuss how fear, obedience, guilt, isolation, and spiritual authority were used to shape behavior and suppress autonomy, and how these patterns mirror what experts describe as coercive control in cults and abusive systems. There were no physical chains — but the psychological pressure was constant.

Our goal isn’t to attack faith or people, but to name the mechanisms of control so others can better understand their experiences. If you’ve ever questioned why it was so hard to leave, why you doubted yourself, or why the impact lasted long after you walked away — you’re not alone.

This conversation is for anyone navigating religious trauma, recovering from high-control groups, or trying to make sense of a system that demanded loyalty at the expense of personal freedom.

💬 If this resonates with you, feel free to share your story in the comments.
🔔 Subscribe for more conversations about healing, autonomy, and life after high-control environments.

#CoerciveControl #ReligiousTrauma #HighControlReligion #CultRecovery #SpiritualAbuse #TraumaBonds #PsychologicalAbuse #Deconstruction #ReligiousTraumaRecovery #HealingJourney

episodes.title: Why Leaving a Trauma Bond is So Hard
episodes.description:
Are you wondering if you’re in a trauma bond? In this video, we break down 12 signs of a trauma bond—the emotional, psychological, and behavioral patterns that keep people stuck in abusive or controlling relationships. Trauma bonds are common in narcissistic abuse, toxic family systems, coercive control, and high-control religious groups.

We explain how trauma bonds form, why they’re so hard to leave, and how abusers create cycles of fear, reward, guilt, and dependency. We also share insights from our own experience growing up and leaving a high-control environment, and how recognizing these signs helped us finally break free.
In this video, you’ll learn:
• What a trauma bond is
• 12 common signs you may be in a trauma bond
• How narcissistic and controlling people create these cycles
• Why victims feel stuck, guilty, or responsible
• How trauma bonds affect your identity and decision making

If you’re researching trauma bonding, narcissistic abuse, emotional manipulation, or coercive control, this breakdown will help you understand the patterns and take the first steps toward clarity and healing.
You are not alone, and what you’re feeling makes sense.Your story matters. Your healing matters.


#traumabond #traumabonding #signsofatraumabond #narcissisticabuse
#narcissisticabuserecovery #narcissisticfamily #coercivecontrol #emotionalabuse #toxicrelationships #healingfromabuse #religiousabuse #highcontrolgroups #cultsurvivor #cptsdrecovery

episodes.title: Inside a High-Control "Church": Growing Up Under Extreme Control, Punishment, and Abuse
episodes.description:
In this video, I share the truth about the childhood abuse that we experienced growing up inside a high-control, Christian environment that justified physical punishment and emotional harm in the name of “discipline" and "obedience.”

This video is about exposing systems of abuse: the punishments, the fear, the silence, and the heavy expectations placed on children who were taught they had to be “broken” to be good.

What I talk about in this video:
• The forms of abuse that were normalized in childhood
• How church leaders and parents enforced punishment
• The emotional and physical impact years later

If you grew up in a religious setting where abuse was masked as discipline or spirituality, you’re not alone. Your story matters. You deserve freedom, safety, and your own voice.

✨ Subscribe for more healing-centered videos about abuse recovery, and spiritual trauma.

#ChildhoodAbuse #ReligiousTrauma #SpiritualAbuse #AbuseSurvivor #HealingJourney #ChristianCult

episodes.title: Inside the Hierarchy of a High-Control Christian Group
episodes.description:
In this video, we break down the hierarchy, structure, and power system of the Christian cult we grew up in, and the impact that this had on our upbringing. Before talking about the punishments, rules, and daily life, it’s important to explain how the group was built — who held authority, how decisions were made, and how obedience was demanded.

This video explains:
-How the leadership structure worked
-How the hierarchy in the group was established. 
-How control was maintained through fear, and obedience. 
-How the specific behavior demands like saying Yes Sir, Yes ma'am, or "Delayed obedience is disobedience," groomed an entire generation of followers. 

Growing up in a high-control religious environment shapes your identity, your trust in yourself, and your understanding of the world. Our goal with this video is to help others recognize the signs of unhealthy power structures and understand how these groups operate from the inside. 

If you grew up in a restrictive Christian group, high-control religion, or a system that demanded unquestioning obedience, you’re not alone. Your story matters. And healing is possible.

Thank you for watching and for supporting our journey at The McMasters’ Chronicles!

#narcissisticabuse #ReligiousTrauma #CultSurvivor #SpiritualAbuse #HighControlGroup #Christianity #Deconstruction #GrowingUpInACult

episodes.title: How Narcissistic Pastors Blame You for Their Abusive Behavior
episodes.description:
In this video we describe five ways our former pastors used accusations, twisted scripture, and weaponized shame to hurt and entrap the very people that they were supposed to protect. We also discuss how narcissists accuse in order to maintain their power and to avoid accountability. If you've ever been blamed, scapegoated or told you were the problem when you were just trying to survive. . . this video is for you. 

If you've left an abusive church like us, have come out of a high-control environment, or you're trying to make sense of the confusion and spiritual gaslighting- you are not alone! Healing is possible and your story matters! 

#cultsurvivor #narcissisticabuse #spiritualabuse #healingjourney #exvangelical #healingjourney

episodes.title: What Isolation Looks Like in High-Control Churches
episodes.description:
Many high-control religious groups use isolation as one of their most powerful tactics. It doesn't start all at once- it starts with subtle shifts, quiet pressure, and spiritual language that makes you feel like you're the problem for wanting connection outside of the group. 

In this video we break down 5 ways high-control religious groups isolate victims, how these tactics were used in the specific group that we were in, and how these methods changed the perception of ourselves, our faith, and others. 

If you've ever felt cut off from family, friends, community, or even your own sense of self, because of a church or a pastor you are not alone. 

Our hope is that this video gives language to what you lived through- and reminds you that your story matters. 

If this resonates with you, share your experience in the comments! 

#religioustrauma #spiritualhealing #cultsurvivor #culttactics #isolation #escaping #recovery #recoveryjourney

episodes.title: Part 2: The Truth About Leaving- How Our Pastors (Cult Leaders) Responded to Being Confronted
episodes.description:
We continue our discussion on how it feels impossible to leave abusive churches/cult-like organizations. We tell how we knew it was time to go, and how we left. We also discuss how the "pastor's" responded to that. 

Share your story in the comments below! 
Subscribe for more conversations on faith, healing, and breaking free from religious control. 

#spiritualabuse #narcissisticabuse #boundedchoice #religiousabuse #faithjourney #faithoverfear #trapped

episodes.title: Part 1: The Truth About Leaving a Controlling and Abusive Church (Cult)
episodes.description:
We didn’t stay because we wanted to — we stayed because we felt like we couldn’t leave. We stayed because we knew we wouldn't be able to talk with people we knew our whole lives. We stayed because leaving felt like we were betraying God and leaving his will for our lives. 

In this episode of the McMasters Chronicles, we share our real story of spiritual abuse, control, and fear inside a toxic church environment. We talk about how manipulation and guilt made leaving feel impossible. 

If you’ve ever felt trapped in a controlling church or pressured to stay silent, you’re not alone. There’s hope, healing, and truth waiting for you.

💬 Share your story in the comments below 
🔔 Subscribe for more conversations on faith, healing, and breaking free from religious control.

#spiritualabuse  #narcissisticabuse #cultsurvivor #religiousabuse #faithjourney #horror #scary #trapped

episodes.title: 🚩11 Warning Signs That Your Church May Be Toxic🚩
episodes.description:
Are you seeing red flags in your church? 

In this video we share warning signs that may indicate a church is spiritually abusive or controlling. These are patterns we personally experienced- and now we want to help others recognize the same signs before they cause deeper harm. 

We talk honestly about manipulation, fear-based leadership, and how love and obedience can be twisted to control people. Our goal is to bring clarity, hope, and freedom to those who have felt trapped, confused or silenced in unhealthy religious environments. 

#redflags #relationshipredflags #religioustrauma #spiritualabuse #coercivecontrol #cultsurvivor

episodes.title: Part 2: Our Honest Account of Spiritually Abusive Sunday Services
episodes.description:
In this episode of the McMasters' Chronicles, we open up about the pressures we faced during our former "church's" services- the expectations, the fear, the constant criticism and the leaderships demands for us to follow their distorted rules. We talk honestly about how spiritual abuse can disguise itself as "obedience" or "worship." All of these demands were given in the context of this is what God required from us. We believe these situations occurred because it was what the abusive leadership needed to pressure us with in order for them to maintain their control over the congregation. These conditions kept us afraid, ashamed, worried of our standing before God, and vulnerable to the financial demands that often followed the services. 

While we remembered several stories, it is impossible to recount the numerous times and situations these tactics were use against the congregation in our former church (cult).

#cultsurvivor #spiritualabuse #faithoverfear #faithjourney #coercivecontrol #abusesurvivors

episodes.title: Part 1: Our Honest Account of Spiritually Abusive Wednesday Night Prayer Meetings
episodes.description:
In this episode of the McMasters' Chronicles, we open up about the pressures we faced during our former "church's" services- the expectations, the fear, the constant criticism and the leaderships demands for us to follow their distorted rules. We talk honestly about how spiritual abuse can disguise itself as "obedience" or "worship." All of these demands were given in the context of this is what God required from us. We believe these situations occurred because it was what the leadership needed to pressure us with in order for them to maintain their control over the congregation. These conditions kept us afraid, ashamed, worried of our standing before God, and vulnerable to the financial demands that often followed the services. 

While we remembered several stories, it is impossible to recount the numerous times and situations these tactics were use against the congregation in our former church (cult).

#cultsurvivor #narcissisticabuse #spiritualabuse #coercivecontrol #abusesurvivors #faithoverfear

episodes.title: Exposing the Cycle of Coercion and Control in Our Former "Church"
episodes.description:
In this episode of The McMasters' Chronicles we ask a simple but powerful question- Why is there always a "need?" In our former church there was always a great degree of financial need even with all the tithes coming into the ministry.

We share our personal experience in a ministry that consistently demanded more- more time, more sacrifice- all under the banner of these WORKS being a requirement to be closer with God and the leadership. While they would speak on Ephesians and the efficacy of grace, their actions were very different from their occasional expositions. What you did for THEM, was of the utmost importance. Not serving them would lead to messages, sermons, verbal assaults, and public shaming in person, by phone, or by message apps. 

#spiritualabuse #churchhurt #narcissisticabuse #financialabuse #narcissisticabuseawareness #cultsurvivor

episodes.title: The Need: How Our Church Used Spiritual Abuse for Financial Gain
episodes.description:
In our former "church" we were required to give above the regular 10% of tithes. While we tried to tell the leaders that we could not always make this quota, they did not accept this and said that we could "not muzzle the ox" and the pastors couldn't go without a paycheck. 

#coercivecontrol #cultsurvivor #narcissisticabuse #churchabuse #financialabuse #spiritualabuse

episodes.title: How Toxic Churches Weaponize Communication
episodes.description:
Jonathan and I discuss how the leaders of our former "church" would require  detailed communication in services and over message boards and relate it to our spiritual standing before Christ. Using the backdrop of scripture, they would highlight how the Bible encourages communication, and thus use this to demand personal details and daily communication. What was communicated  would include, intimate, personal and private information that would not normally be required in healthy churches and relationships. "Not communicating" or "silence" became the ultimate "sin" and at any moment you could be accused of this. Not communicating "enough" meant that you were lesser and flawed. On occasion one of the leaders would post the Simon and Garfunkel song, The Sound of Silence, to scold members publicly for not communicating. 

#cult #emotionalabuse #cultsurvivor #spiritualabuse #churchtrauma #spiritualmanipulation #thesoundofsilence #narcissisticabuse #narcissisticabuseawareness #narcissisticabuserecovery

episodes.title: This Story was Used to Scare Us Into Not Questioning Authority
episodes.description:
In this video we discuss how yet another biblical passage was used by our former "church" to cause fear and gain control over the congregation. The "preaching" on specific passage made the congregants feel like they could not question or criticize leadership under penalty of spiritual or physical harm. 

#spiritualabuseawareness #narcissisticabuse #cultsurvivor #coercivecontrol #religioustrauma #elisha

episodes.title: The Story of Korah: Misused Scripture, Control and Fear
episodes.description:
In this video we detail how this biblical passage is used by the leaders of our former church/cult to intimidate the congregation and deter them from speaking up about abuses and injustices that go on. 

#spiritualabuse #faithoverfear #narcissisticabuse #bible #cultsurvivor #numbers16 #churchaccountability #faithjourney

episodes.title: The Shocking Way our Former Church used Ananias & Sapphira
episodes.description:
We discuss how the story of Ananias and Sapphira was told by our former "pastors" in order to manipulate the congregation into giving everything they had. The twisting of this Biblical passage was used to perpetuate financial abuse, create fear and spur financial giving. 

#financialabuse #coercivecontrol #spiritualabuse #churchhurt #narcissisticabuse #jesuslovesyou #jesussaves #cultsurvivor #churchabuse #church #ananias&sapphira #acts5

episodes.title: How our Former "Church" used Matthew 18 to Avoid Accountability
episodes.description:
In this video we describe how our former "pastors" twisted the Matthew 18 passage to avoid accountability. This twisting of scripture specifically was and is currently being used to keep people in their congregation who love God and who want to address problems in a "godly" manner. They skillfully avoid accountability by finding fault in how problems are brought up. We use examples from our leaving story to show how we tried to follow Matthew 18. Jonathan first went to the pastors prior to leaving and then we went to the church by putting a letter on the church door. However, no matter what we did, we would have always been considered wrong because the sin of our "pastor" wasn't the issue, it was the fact that we were questioning their "God-given authority."

#church #cultsurvivor #spiritualabuse #narcissisticabuse #bible #jesuslovesyou #jesussaves #narcissisticabuseawareness #churchhurt #churches #churchabuse #matthew18

episodes.title: DARVO
episodes.description:
In this new series, Our Abusive "Pastor's" Playbook, we outline different tacts that our former church used to confuse and manipulate the congregation. These tactics made it difficult to leave the group. Today we talk about DARVO, which stands for deny, attack/accuse, reverse the victim and offender. 

#narcissisticabuse #cultsurvivor #churchhurt #spiritualabuse #coercivecontrol #jesuslovesyou #jesussaves

episodes.title: Freedom and Betrayal: The Cost of Leaving an Abusive "Church"
episodes.description:
We discuss the pain of dealing with someone leaving the group and the emotional, and verbal abuse that came from our former "church" leaders toward us to further isolate us from the people that left. We also discuss the difficulties of leaving our former "church" and not being able to speak with our lifelong friends. We talk about how leaving is difficult, but it is possible. Talking with former friends or outside counselors can help you identify toxic patterns in your relationships. 

#religion #christianity #spiritualabuse #narcissisticabuse #narcissist #narcissisticabuseawareness #recovery

episodes.title: Forced Labor Disguised as "Unity"
episodes.description:
We talk about how owning a business in our former "church" meant that the "pastor" could interfere at whim in the day to day running of the business. Our emotional and spiritual wellbeing would be tied to the success of the business and providing. Others who didn't own businesses were expected to work at the business to help bring in funds for the church. 

#exploitation #cultsurvivor #narcissisticabuseawareness #spiritualabuse #financialabuse #narcissisticabuse #coercivecontrol #religion

episodes.title: The Love Bombing Week
episodes.description:
Our "Church" called us Ahab and Jezebel in order to spiritually manipulate us after we left. 

#narcissisticabuse #spiritualabuse #cultsurvivor #

episodes.title: Leaving for good!
episodes.description:
After receiving the shocking text message from an elder pastor, we are reeling. While we were on the trip, we come to terms with the fact that we cannot continue in this "church." We mourn the loss of friendships because we knew that we would not be able to speak with our friends again or relate with them in the same way. Jonathan mourns the relationships he thought he had with the leaders. Jonathan wanted to make sure that he was leaving in the right way- although this was not possible in this organization. We leave our trip to Tennessee early to head back and attend the Sunday night service for the last time. The elder pastor spent the entire sermon criticizing us going on the trip and then doubles down on the sentiments expressed in the heinous text message. 

#churchabuse #cultsurvivor #cultabuse #narcissisticabuse #spiritualabuse #coercivecontrol

episodes.title: August 7, 2024: Realizing Things Will Never Change
episodes.description:
This Wednesday Jonathan met with the lead "pastor" to address the mistreatments and issues that were going on. He was gaslit and made to feel like he was the one with the issues and sinning. While Jonathan started to believe them he was realizing that they were never going to address their misdeeds or change. 

#abusesurvivors #spiritualabuse #narcissisticabuse #cultsurvivor #cultabuse

episodes.title: July 24, 2024 - The Beginning of Our Exit: Leaving An Abusive "Church" Part 2
episodes.description: A year ago, on July 24th, 2024 Jonathan began to realize that the pastors and friends that he had for his whole life were abusive to him. While being confronted in front of the whole church, shamed, damned and criticized loudly, was not a new occurrence in this organization, Jonathan's willingness to accept this abuse was waning. We remember this defining moment when he decided not to receive the abuse any longer. This day was the first in an 18 day assault on our lives and our position before God. #abusesurvivors #cultsurvivor #spiritualabuse #McMastersChronicles

episodes.title: July 24, 2024 - The Beginning of Our Exit: Leaving An Abusive "Church" Part 1
episodes.description:
A year ago, on July 24th, 2024 Jonathan began to realize that the pastors and friends that he had for his whole life were abusive to him. While being confronted in front of the whole church, shamed, damned and criticized loudly, was not a new occurrence in this organization, Jonathan's willingness to accept this abuse was waning. We remember this defining moment when he decided not to receive the abuse any longer. This day was the first in an 18 day assault on our lives and our position before God. #abusesurvivors #cultsurvivor #spiritualabuse #McMastersChronicles
